bug.short_desc: Reminder: Webkit always caches JS files

long_desc.thetext:
Hi!
This is just a reminder bug to keep in mind, that Webkit caches JS files until you close the application and restart it.
See https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=22568 for details.
We could use Martin's idea as a workaround for this bug and other issues in FireBug: bug #2619

This would also affect typical end-user apps, given the JS sources are updated in-place on the web server?? This sounds like a severe bug in Webkit. But I then wonder why their bug report hasn't been confirmed or addressed, yet?
Martin, please update/extend this bug report to cover all critical scenarios.

Looks like the build application is not affected by this behavior. Only the source version can "hang" in its old status and lead the developer to some serious headache. I could also not reproduce the caching problem without a qooxdoo application. It looks like our loading mechanism has something to do with this problem. Including a simple javascript file into a plain html file always worked.

Martin, since you looked into this issue and also worked on the related bug #2619, I'd like you to keep following/workaround this issue. Adjusted severity/prio to match the scenarios (developer, source version).
I had such an issue with CSS files as well. Does not seem to be related to the loading mechanism. Maybe Safari's cache handling has issues as soon as you reach a specific number of external files?!?
Sebastian, perhaps you want to ask this in the Webkit Bugzilla as well (https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=22568) or open a new bug.
I am not sure that this is even the same bug. But it's definitely related. The problem is that one needs a reproducible example which is currently nothing I have.
If you want to get a workaround for that bug, see comment #1.
*** Bug 3263 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

We have the same problem with IE8. Looking over the code i found out that the "nocache" parameter is missing. In the source version all requests that loaded resources had a nocache parameter added to the request. Please make this nocache parameter available again (e.g. as a variant).
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
